00034 bool toLower(string& s)
00035 {
00036     for (size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i)
00037     {
00038         char c = s[i];
00039         if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z'))
00040         {
00041             c += 'a' - 'A';
00042             s[i] = c;
00043         }
00044     }
00045 
00046     return true;
00047 }
00048 
00049 string create_filename(const string &path, const string &file)
00050 {
00051     string s = path;
00052 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00053     if (s.size() && s[s.size()-1] != '\\') s += '\\';
00054 #else
00055     if (s.size() && s[s.size()-1] != '/') s += '/';
00056 #endif
00057     s += file;
00058     return s;
00059 }

00061 bool enum_csv_dictionaries(const char *path, vector<string>& dics)
00062 {
00063     dics.clear();
00064 
00065 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00066     WIN32_FIND_DATA wfd;
00067     HANDLE hFind;
00068     const string pat = create_filename(path, "*.csv");
00069     hFind = FindFirstFile(pat.c_str(), &wfd);
00070     if(hFind == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00071     {
00072         cerr << "Invalid File Handle. Get Last Error reports";
00073         return false;
00074     }
00075     do {
00076         string tmp = create_filename(path, wfd.cFileName);
00077         dics.push_back(tmp);
00078     } while (FindNextFile(hFind, &wfd));
00079     FindClose(hFind);
00080 #else
00081     DIR *dir = opendir(path);
00082     if(dir == 0)
00083     {
00084         cerr << "no such directory: " << path << endl;
00085         return false;
00086     }
00087 
00088     for (struct dirent *dp = readdir(dir); dp; dp = readdir(dir)) {
00089         const string tmp = dp->d_name;
00090         if (tmp.size() >= 5) {
00091             string ext = tmp.substr(tmp.size() - 4, 4);
00092             toLower(ext);
00093             if (ext == ".csv")
00094                 dics.push_back(create_filename(path, tmp));
00095         }
00096     }
00097     closedir(dir);
00098 #endif
00099     return true;
00100 }

00108 string::size_type findSeparator(const string& str, size_t n)
00109 {
00110     string::size_type r = 0;
00111 
00112 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00113     cout << str << endl;
00114 #endif
00115     for(size_t i=0; i<n && r<str.size(); ++i)
00116     {
00117         // skip the element between ""
00118         if(str[r] == '"')
00119         {
00120             r = str.find('"', r+1);
00121         }
00122 
00123         r = str.find(',', r);
00124 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00125         cout << r << endl;
00126 #endif
00127         if(r == string::npos)
00128         {
00129             break;
00130         }
00131 
00132         // forward index
00133         ++r;
00134     }
00135 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00136     cout << endl;
00137 #endif
00138 
00139     if(r != string::npos)
00140     {
00141         // backward index to separator
00142         --r;
00143     }
00144 
00145     return r;
00146 }

00155 bool extractPOS(const vector<string>& dics, set<string>& posSet, size_t posColumn)
00156 {
00157     // start column of POS in "*.csv" file
00158     size_t posStart = 4;
00159 
00160     for(size_t index=0; index<dics.size(); ++index)
00161     {
00162         ifstream from(dics[index].c_str());
00163         if(! from)
00164         {
00165             cerr << "failed to open file " << dics[index] << endl;
00166             return false;
00167         }
00168 
00169         string line;
00170         string::size_type i, j;
00171         while(getline(from, line))
00172         {
00173             if(! line.empty())
00174             {
00175 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00176                 cout << line << endl;
00177 #endif
00178                 i = findSeparator(line, posStart);
00179                 j = findSeparator(line, posStart + posColumn);
00180 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00181                 cout << i << ", " << j << endl;
00182 #endif
00183 
00184                 if(i != string::npos && j != string::npos)
00185                 {
00186                     posSet.insert(line.substr(i+1, j-i-1));
00187 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00188                     cout << line.substr(i+1, j-i-1) << endl;
00189                     cout << endl;
00190 #endif
00191                 }
00192             }
00193         }
00194     }
00195 
00196     return true;
00197 }

00210 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00211 {
00212     if(argc < 3)
00213     {
00214         printUsage();
00215         exit(1);
00216     }
00217 
00218     const char* srcPath = argv[1];
00219     const char* posFile = argv[2];
00220 
00221     vector<string> dics;
00222     bool r = enum_csv_dictionaries(srcPath, dics);
00223     if(! r)
00224     {
00225         cerr << "error in enum_csv_dictionaries()" << endl;
00226         exit(1);
00227     }
00228 
00229 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00230     cout << dics.size() << " *.csv in srcPath: " << srcPath << endl;
00231     for(size_t i=0; i<dics.size(); ++i)
00232     {
00233         cout << dics[i] << endl;
00234     }
00235     cout << endl;
00236 #endif
00237 
00238     size_t posColumn;
00239     cout << "how many POS columns in *.csv files?" << endl;
00240     cin >> posColumn;
00241 
00242     set<string> posSet;
00243     r = extractPOS(dics, posSet, posColumn);
00244     if(! r)
00245     {
00246         cerr << "error in extractPOS()" << endl;
00247         exit(1);
00248     }
00249 
00250 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00251     cout << posSet.size() << " POS:" << endl;
00252     for(set<string>::const_iterator i=posSet.begin(); i!=posSet.end(); ++i)
00253     {
00254         cout << *i << endl;
00255     }
00256     cout << endl;
00257 #endif
00258 
00259     ofstream to(posFile);
00260     if(! to)
00261     {
00262         cerr << "failed to create file " << posFile << endl;
00263         exit(1);
00264     }
00265 
00266     size_t index = 0;
00267     for(set<string>::const_iterator i=posSet.begin(); i!=posSet.end(); ++i)
00268     {
00269         to << *i << " " << index++ << endl;
00270     }
00271 
00272     cout << "succeeded in generating " << posFile << " from " << srcPath << endl;
00273 
00274     return 0;
00275 }
